documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
he  famous  philosopher
Benedict  de  Spinoza  was  a  valuable  resource  to  me  in  trying  to  analyze
Spinoza’s own argument for God. So it’s a genuine honor to be sharing the
podium with Dr. Curley tonight.
Now in tonight’s debate it seems that there are two basic questions that
we need to ask ourselves:
I. Are there any good reasons to think that God does not exist?
And
II. Are there good reasons to think that God does exist?
Now with respect to the first question, I’ll leave it up to Dr.
